verb.description: Kill, destroy, or remove a large percentage or part of.
examples: the project would decimate the fragile wetland wilderness
the American chestnut, a species decimated by blight

verb.description: Kill one in every ten of (a group of soldiers or others) as a punishment for the whole group.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin decimat- taken as a tenth, from the verb decimare, from decimus tenth. In Middle English the term decimation denoted the levying of a tithe, and later the tax imposed by Cromwell on the Royalists (1655).
